overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Monitoring.

google-cloud is deprecated

Due to the scope of our API rapidly increasing, you may notice a decrease in performance if you continue to use the bundled module, google-cloud.

Going forward, please install only the individual service modules that you need, such as @google-cloud/monitoring.

First, install google-cloud with npm:

$ npm install --save google-cloud

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to google-cloudâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var monitoring = gcloud.monitoring();

Elsewhere

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var monitoring = gcloud.monitoring({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to google-cloud are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: GroupServiceClient
methods.description:
The Group API lets you inspect and manage your groups.

A group is a named filter that is used to identify a collection of monitored resources. Groups are typically used to mirror the physical and/or logical topology of the environment. Because group membership is computed dynamically, monitored resources that are started in the future are automatically placed in matching groups. By using a group to name monitored resources in, for example, an alert policy, the target of that alert policy is updated automatically as monitored resources are added and removed from the infrastructure.

This will be created through a builder function which can be obtained by the module. See the following example of how to initialize the module and how to access to the builder.

methods.name: projectPath
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified project resource name string.

methods.name: matchProjectFromProjectName
methods.description: Parses the projectName from a project resource.

params.name: projectName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a project resources.

methods.name: groupPath
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified group resource name string.

methods.name: matchProjectFromGroupName
methods.description: Parses the groupName from a group resource.

params.name: groupName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a group resources.

methods.name: matchGroupFromGroupName
methods.description: Parses the groupName from a group resource.

params.name: groupName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a group resources.

methods.name: getProjectId
methods.description: Get the project ID used by this class.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name
params.description: The project whose groups are to be listed. The format is "projects/{project_id_or_number}".

params.name: request.childrenOfGroup
params.description: A group name: "projects/{project_id_or_number}/groups/{group_id}". Returns groups whose parentName field contains the group name. If no groups have this parent, the results are empty.

params.name: request.ancestorsOfGroup
params.description: A group name: "projects/{project_id_or_number}/groups/{group_id}". Returns groups that are ancestors of the specified group. The groups are returned in order, starting with the immediate parent and ending with the most distant ancestor. If the specified group has no immediate parent, the results are empty.

params.name: request.descendantsOfGroup
params.description: A group name: "projects/{project_id_or_number}/groups/{group_id}". Returns the descendants of the specified group. This is a superset of the results returned by the childrenOfGroup filter, and includes children-of-children, and so forth.

params.name: request.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is Array of Group.

When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, it contains the result in a single response. If the response indicates the next page exists, the third parameter is set to be used for the next request object. The fourth parameter keeps the raw response object of an object representing ListGroupsResponse.

returns.description:
• The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is Array of Group.

    When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, the array has three elements. The first element is Array of Group in a single response. The second element is the next request object if the response indicates the next page exists, or null. The third element is an object representing ListGroupsResponse.

    The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: listGroupsStream
methods.description:
Equivalent to {@link listGroups}, but returns a NodeJS Stream object.

This fetches the paged responses for {@link listGroups} continuously and invokes the callback registered for 'data' event for each element in the responses.

The returned object has 'end' method when no more elements are required.

autoPaginate option will be ignored.

params.name: request.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

returns.description: An object stream which emits an object representing Group on 'data' event.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name
params.description: The group to retrieve. The format is "projects/{project_id_or_number}/groups/{group_id}".

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing Group.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing Group. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name
params.description: The project in which to create the group. The format is "projects/{project_id_or_number}".

params.name: request.group
params.description:
A group definition. It is an error to define the name field because the system assigns the name.

This object should have the same structure as Group

params.name: request.validateOnly
params.description: If true, validate this request but do not create the group.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing Group.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing Group. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: updateGroup
methods.description: Updates an existing group. You can change any group attributes except name.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.group
params.description:
The new definition of the group. All fields of the existing group, excepting name, are replaced with the corresponding fields of this group.

This object should have the same structure as Group

params.name: request.validateOnly
params.description: If true, validate this request but do not update the existing group.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing Group.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing Group. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name
params.description: The group to delete. The format is "projects/{project_id_or_number}/groups/{group_id}".

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description: The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves when API call finishes. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: listGroupMembers
methods.description: Lists the monitored resources that are members of a group.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name
params.description: The group whose members are listed. The format is "projects/{project_id_or_number}/groups/{group_id}".

params.name: request.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of resources in a page.

params.name: request.filter
params.description:
An optional list filter describing the members to be returned. The filter may reference the type, labels, and metadata of monitored resources that comprise the group. For example, to return only resources representing Compute Engine VM instances, use this filter:

 resource.type = "gce_instance"

params.name: request.interval
params.description:
An optional time interval for which results should be returned. Only members that were part of the group during the specified interval are included in the response. If no interval is provided then the group membership over the last minute is returned.

This object should have the same structure as TimeInterval

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is Array of google.api.MonitoredResource.

When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, it contains the result in a single response. If the response indicates the next page exists, the third parameter is set to be used for the next request object. The fourth parameter keeps the raw response object of an object representing ListGroupMembersResponse.

returns.description:
• The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is Array of google.api.MonitoredResource.

    When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, the array has three elements. The first element is Array of google.api.MonitoredResource in a single response. The second element is the next request object if the response indicates the next page exists, or null. The third element is an object representing ListGroupMembersResponse.

    The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: listGroupMembersStream
methods.description:
Equivalent to {@link listGroupMembers}, but returns a NodeJS Stream object.

This fetches the paged responses for {@link listGroupMembers} continuously and invokes the callback registered for 'data' event for each element in the responses.

The returned object has 'end' method when no more elements are required.

autoPaginate option will be ignored.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

returns.description: An object stream which emits an object representing google.api.MonitoredResource on 'data' event.

params.name: opts
params.description: • The optional parameters.

params.name: opts.servicePath
params.description: The domain name of the API remote host.

params.name: opts.port
params.description: The port on which to connect to the remote host.

params.name: opts.sslCreds
params.description: A ClientCredentials for use with an SSL-enabled channel.

params.name: opts.clientConfig
params.description: The customized config to build the call settings. See {@link gax.constructSettings} for the format.
